page.title: 07Ecology
page.content: In Willoughby lives a man who has been at the forefront of nature con- servation (see Biography) and he and his wife have been instrumental in improving the ecology of the area. There are two areas designated as of importance,a meadow on the outskirts of Willoughby and an old quarry in Claxby. The meadow has in it 117 different species of wild flower and is a good example of how grassland was until the advent of modern farming techniques. The quarry was active until a few years ago and chalk was quarried there.The last foreman,Mr.Hildred,re- tired to the village.When in charge of the workings,he and his wife lived in a wooden bungalow at the pit entrance.There was also a blacksmith's shop there and lime-kilns,the remains of which can still be seen.
